SupportingEvidence: WNT/β-catenin activation signature (LEF1, APCDD1, NKD1, TBX3, LIX1)
Hepatoblast/progenitor program indicated by TBX3 and LEF1; absence of mature hepatocyte markers
Mesenchymal/osteochondral differentiation signals (RUNX2, MATN3, CHST11, LEPR) alongside epithelial/progenitor genes, consistent with mixed epithelial–mesenchymal features
Muscle/contractile and atrophy-related genes (MYH7B, FBXO32) supporting mesenchymal components
Neuro/glutamatergic-associated genes (GRM3, HOMER2, SERPINI1) often seen in mixed/teratoid HB contexts
Metabolic rewiring with glutamine transporter SLC1A5 typical of WNT-driven progenitor-like cells
SuggestedExperiments: IHC/IF: nuclear β-catenin, LEF1, TBX3; mesenchymal/osteochondral markers RUNX2, MATN3, SOX9; epithelial (EPCAM, KRT19) vs mesenchymal (VIM) markers
Histochemical stains: Alcian blue (chondroid) and Alizarin red/von Kossa (osteoid) to confirm mixed differentiation
Genetic/functional WNT assays: CTNNB1/AXIN1 sequencing and TCF/LEF reporter activity
Spatial transcriptomics to map epithelial vs mesenchymal regions within the tumor
Organoid derivation with WNT modulation; test SLC1A5 dependence using glutamine starvation or ASCT2 inhibitors
